group_1.narration: Both the Circus, and the sand spread@for its sad duties in the bustling Forum,@will afford these overtures to a dawning passion.@â€” Ovidius, The Art of Love, Vol. I.

group_1.textLeft: Now, then...
Let's start by considering what should be@our topmost priority.

group_1.textRight: That's gotta be your date with Marius!@Like, for sure!

group_1.textLeft: You're right. We can't let all our hard work@go to waste here.
So please proceed to the race as planned,@Lady Cornelia!

group_1.textRight: And then, and then!@We need to get my phone back, too...

group_1.textLeft: Your phone is at the jewelry dealer's place, right...

group_1.narration: Lord Pliny's nephew, Lord Gaius, is planning to visit@the exchange after he has made the necessary payment.
Lady Cornelia's father will also be there to@give away the item in question...@Lady Miyurin's phone.

group_1.textLeft: ...Maybe I could insist on begging for@Miyurin's phone,
and work to keep him from giving it@away to Lord Gaius?

group_1.textRight: That makes sense!

group_1.textLeft: Your father has a soft spot for you after all,@Lady Cornelia.

group_1.textRight: ...We better hurry. I'm going to speak with Father.

group_1.textLeft: ...How did it go?

group_1.textRight: The request itself was accepted.
But there is a condition.
Since he is going to renege on the promise@he had made,
he wants me to be there when he meets@with the jeweler in the evening
to apologize to Lord Gaius.

group_1.textLeft: I'm sorry...

group_1.textRight: And, depending on how things go, we may@still have to give it to him.

group_1.textLeft: What...?
He's already seen the phone with the app@running, hasn't he?
He must be desperate to get it for his uncle@Pliny at any cost.

group_1.textRight: Yeah. If he asks for it for ten times the price...

group_1.textLeft: He's a family member of a high military official. Your@father cannot afford to give him no as an answer.
...What do we do...?

group_1.textRight: I wonder if there's anything we can do with@Amaryllis' magic...

group_1.textCenter: Y'know, I think Hiko-kun's got a good idea!
He doesn't seem too keen on it though,@'cause it means deceiving everyone.

group_1.textRight: It's better than letting Miyu's phone fall into the@hands of a major historical figure!

group_1.textLeft: What's the plan?

group_1.textRight: Let this cutie explain!
...We have no other choice.@Let's go with that strategy.
You're right, it's a little awkward...but we@mustn't fail, right?
If a time paradox of this magnitude occurs,@it will be the end...

group_1.textLeft: It's Miyu's carelessness that got us into this mess...@I'll do whatever I can to help!

group_1.textCenter: Let me summarize what we need to do.
First, Lady Cornelia can enjoy the chariot race...
Lady Himena and the rest of us will find Lord Gaius,@who should be somewhere in town...
Lady Cornelia will go with her father to the trading@post, where the jeweler is waiting...
The rest should go smoothly as long as we follow@Lord Hiko's plan!

group_1.textRight: Though we have to locate Gaius by evening to@make it work.
We and Amaryllis will have to split up to@find him, huh...

group_1.textLeft: Thank you so much, everyone...!

group_1.textRight: No need to thank us. We are the ones causing the@trouble we're solving in the first place.

group_1.textLeft: Ah...here comes Lord Marius!

group_1.textCenter: Sorry to keep you waiting, Cornelia!@I'm looking forward to today's race.

group_1.textLeft: Lord Marius...!@Thank you for picking me up.
